page.title: 09VALE OF CLWYD,FARM PATTERNS.
page.content: The geography of farms in this area is changing.There is a tendancy now for some tenant farms to be absorbed into bigger estates when the tenant dies instead of passing to the next generation(whether because of lack of interest,or for economic reasons)In these cases the farmhouse may be sold separately or left empty.A recent disturbing feature is the{practice of {dividing farms for sale}.Thus one section may consist of the house and building,and the rest sold in 30_50 acre sections.This is more profitable for the seller but destroys the farm as a unit.When the owner reaches retirement,or becomes unable to continue farming,and has no children to follow on,many farmers prefer to sublet the land for grazing and remain in the farmhouse,where they have always lived. {
